Text: The internet has only made it easier for sex traffickers to operate in the shadows. We must act legislatively to give law enforcement the tools they need to protect children. Read my Op-Ed here:http://www.tennessean.com/story/opinion/2017/11/29/congress-must-stop-sex-trafficking-internet/904404001/ …

In Brentwood, the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation (TBI) arrested 22 men for soliciting sex with a minor through http://backpage.com . This was the 11th sting conducted by the TBI since 2015. This activity is beyond reprehensible.

Using taxpayer dollars to settle sexual harassment claims against members of Congress is disgusting. We're going to release the names of those who used this hush fund, and these individuals will pay this money back to the American people with interest.http://video.foxnews.com/v/5663233115001/?#sp=show-clips …

Happy Thanksgiving! I am so thankful for my family and friends, and for this great nation. What are you most thankful for?
We have to use this time as a tipping point to address the overall issue of inappropriate conduct in the workplace--the lack of respect, the diminishment of women, pushing women aside--and end it.

The @washingtonpost reported that The Office of Compliance paid out $17 million for 264 settlements of federal employees to resolve sexual harassment and other claims over a period of two decades. These are taxpayer dollars. I think it’s absolutely disgusting.

Don’t be fooled by the name “net-neutrality.” Net-neutrality regulates the internet, and is the opposite of a free and open marketplace. I fully support @AjitPaiFCC’s decision.  Read my statement here:https://energycommerce.house.gov/news/press-release/walden-blackburn-fccs-net-neutrality-announcement/ …

@realdonaldtrump’s executive order needs to be in place. What you don’t want to happen is sanctuary cities popping up that are going to be a safe haven or a magnet for more illegal immigration and criminal activity.

What happens if you want to have a sanctuary city for other parts of federal law evasion? Sanctuary cities are a danger to our communities and cities, and a danger to rule of law. I reintroduced the CLEAR Act, which will block funding for sanctuary cities.http://www.foxnews.com/opinion/2017/11/09/rep-marsha-blackburn-to-save-lives-and-money-must-cut-off-federal-funding-for-sanctuary-cities.html …

Finally, we have a leader who is not afraid to stand up to our enemies. I fully support @POTUS' decision to again designate North Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism.
